skill.name: clinical-decision-support
skill.description: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical research settings, including patient cohort analyses (biomarker-stratified with outcomes) and treatment recommendation reports (evidence-based guidelines with decision algorithms). Supports GRADE evidence grading, statistical analysis (hazard ratios, survival curves, waterfall plots), biomarker integration, and regulatory compliance. Outputs publication-ready LaTeX/PDF format optimized for drug development, clinical research, and evidence synthesis.
skill.summary: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical rese...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes local Python scripts that read input data and write analysis outputs. No network activity, external command execution, or environment variable access was found.

content.value_statement: Creating compliant CDS reports is time consuming and error prone. This skill generates structured analyses, tables, and algorithms from your data and notes.
actual_capabilities: Generate Kaplan Meier curves with log rank tests from CSV survival data
Create cohort baseline, efficacy, and safety tables with p values
Build TikZ clinical decision flowcharts from text or JSON
Classify biomarkers such as PD L1 TPS and HER2 status
Validate CDS documents for sections, citations, and HIPAA identifiers
limitations: Does not create individual patient treatment plans
Requires structured CSV inputs for analysis scripts
Does not fetch or verify external literature
Outputs files but does not compile LaTeX to PDF

use_cases.title: Cohort outcomes report
use_cases.description: Analyze biomarker strata, response rates, and survival outcomes for a study cohort.

use_cases.title: Guideline draft pack
use_cases.description: Draft evidence graded recommendations and decision algorithms for internal review.

use_cases.title: Survival analysis bundle
use_cases.description: Generate Kaplan Meier plots, risk tables, and summary statistics from trial data.

prompt_templates.title: Baseline cohort table
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a baseline characteristics table for two groups in my CSV, include p values and note nonnormal variables.

prompt_templates.title: Biomarker stratification
prompt_templates.prompt: Classify HER2 status using IHC and FISH columns, then summarize category counts and export the classified CSV.

prompt_templates.title: Survival curve report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate Kaplan Meier curves by biomarker group with log rank test, median survival, and a statistics summary file.

prompt_templates.title: Decision algorithm TikZ
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this decision pathway into a TikZ flowchart and save it as a LaTeX file ready for inclusion.

output_examples.input: Analyze a PD L1 stratified NSCLC cohort and summarize outcomes.
output: Baseline characteristics table with p values
Kaplan Meier curves with log rank result
Clinical implications summary for the report

best_practices: Provide de identified datasets and clear biomarker definitions
Specify endpoints, units, and statistical assumptions before analysis
Review validation warnings and evidence grading before publishing
anti_patterns: Include identifiable patient data in inputs
Ask for web scraping or external API calls

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It is designed for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows with local files.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It requires structured inputs and does not replace clinical judgment.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts accept CSV inputs and output files for downstream tools.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No network calls are present, so data stays on the local machine.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Review missing sections, citations, or identifiers and rerun validation.

faq.question: How does it compare to general tools?
faq.answer: It provides domain specific templates, statistics, and validation checks.
